focalPoints.rationale: HIGHEST PRIORITY. Enables autonomous decision-making (Observe‚ÜíOrient‚ÜíDecide‚ÜíAct) which is the CORE MISSING PIECE in DAIOF's dormant workflows. Without OODA, workflows are just scheduled scripts. With OODA, they become self-directing organisms. EVIDENCE: system_conflict_resolver.py shows proven 4-phase pattern. URGENCY: Blocks full autonomous capability. ALIGNMENT: B·ªë's directive to integrate OODA for full capacity at cost=0.

SECOND PRIORITY. Solves cost=0 constraint by running workflows on B·ªë's MacBook instead of GitHub Actions cloud. ELIMINATES: $252/year Enterprise plan cost (50,000 min/month). ENABLES: Unlimited execution frequency (every minute for realtime tasks). DEPENDENCY: Requires OODA framework first to make autonomous decisions, otherwise cron just runs dumb scripts. TIMELINE: Implement after OODA integration (Week 2).

proposals.name: Phase 1: Read & Validate ‚Üí Phase 2: Local Prototype ‚Üí Phase 3: Full Integration
steps: WEEK 1 - READ & VALIDATE:
1. Read ooda_autonomous_activator.py, ooda_on_off_analyzer.py, ooda_heartbeat_impact_analyzer.py
2. Understand Observe‚ÜíOrient‚ÜíDecide‚ÜíAct loop implementation
3. Create adaptation plan: Windows paths ‚Üí macOS paths
4. Validate psutil works on macOS (test process detection)
5. Document OODA loop flow diagram
WEEK 2 - LOCAL PROTOTYPE:
6. Create /Users/andy/DAIOF-Framework/.github/scripts/ooda_framework.py
7. Adapt system_conflict_resolver.py ‚Üí DAIOF context (no HyperAI, focus on GitHub workflows)
8. Implement OODA wrapper class: class OODALoop(observe(), orient(), decide(), act())
9. Test locally: python ooda_framework.py --test-mode
10. Validate decision-making logic with dry-run mode (no actual commits)
WEEK 3 - FULL INTEGRATION:
11. Modify realtime_task_generator.py: Add OODALoop wrapper
12. Modify autonomous_developer.py: Add OODALoop wrapper
13. Modify health_monitor.py: Provide data for Observe phase
14. Create local_cron/ooda_unified_startup.sh
15. Add to macOS crontab: */1 * * * * (realtime), 0 */4 * * * (autonomous-dev)
16. Test 24-hour run: Monitor logs, validate no errors
17. Measure: Tasks completed, decisions made, cost = $0 ‚úì
18. LAUNCH: Enable full autonomous system
estimatedRisks: OODA framework might not be compatible with DAIOF architecture (needs code review)
macOS process detection different from Windows (psutil API differences)
Local execution might have GitHub API rate limits (authenticated vs unauthenticated)
Cron jobs might fail if MacBook sleeps (need caffeinate or keep-awake setting)
Decision logic might make wrong choices initially (needs tuning period)
mitigationActions: RISK 1: Read all OODA files FIRST before committing to integration (validate compatibility)
RISK 2: Test psutil on macOS with sample script before full implementation
RISK 3: Use GitHub Personal Access Token in local scripts (same permissions as Actions)
RISK 4: Configure macOS Energy Saver to 'Prevent automatic sleeping' OR use caffeinate command
RISK 5: Start with dry-run mode (log decisions but don't execute) for 1 week tuning
auditChecklist: ‚úÖ All OODA files read and understood (ooda_autonomous_activator.py, analyzers)
‚úÖ psutil process detection working on macOS
‚úÖ OODALoop class implements all 4 phases (Observe, Orient, Decide, Act)
‚úÖ health_monitor.py provides metrics for Observe phase
‚úÖ Cost = $0 validated (no GitHub Actions minutes consumed)

requiredMetadata.success_criteria: Autonomous system making decisions and executing tasks locally with 0 errors

proposals.name: Fast-Track: Direct Adaptation (1 Week)
steps: DAY 1: Read all OODA files in parallel (3-4 hours focused reading)
DAY 2: Create ooda_framework.py with all 4 phases implemented
DAY 3: Integrate into realtime_task_generator.py + autonomous_developer.py
DAY 4: Setup macOS cron jobs, test 4-hour run
DAY 5: Fix bugs, tune decision logic
DAY 6: 24-hour stress test
DAY 7: LAUNCH full autonomous system
estimatedRisks: CRITICAL: Rushing might miss edge cases (bugs in production)
HIGH: Insufficient testing period (1 week vs 3 weeks)
MEDIUM: No dry-run phase (decisions execute immediately)

LOW: Technical debt from quick adaptation

Implement comprehensive logging (every decision logged for post-mortem analysis)
Schedule daily check-ins with B·ªë (15 min status updates)
Plan refactoring sprint in Week 2 (clean up technical debt)

conclusion.summary: OODA Framework integration is the KEY to unlocking DAIOF's $79,200/year dormant automation value at COST=$0. By running workflows locally via macOS cron with OODA decision-making, we bypass GitHub Actions limits entirely. The meta-insight: Once OODA is integrated, the autonomous system can complete its own todo list (analyze itself), demonstrating true autonomous capability.
